comment: My "Yoga With Adriene" Testimonial: For so many years I bought into the "no pain no gain" belief system of fitness. I believed that if I pushed my body through callisthenics, through complicated exercises, through running daily, etc. then and only then would I be able to get "the body I wanted". I am ashamed to say how long it has taken me to realize that that was a lie (at least for me it was). In September (I'm a teacher, so September always seems like a new year to me) I decided all of that wasn't working for me. I knew I needed more stretching in my life, I'm getting older and the old body was just getting stiffer. I then committed to three things fitness-wise: Yoga every day, some form of cardio every day (I still run, but only 3 days a week tops), and more vegetables in my diet. I can't believe the change I've seen in my body in 4 short months. It's amazing how strong I feel, how many compliments I've received, and how great my clothes fit (even going down a size). I am so grateful that I came across your original 30 days of Yoga videos. My life has truly never been the same since then. Thank you Adriene for giving us this gift every day. Blessings to you!
thank you, Adriene! this practice is so joyful💜

Day 62 of 100 days of yoga 🧘🏽‍♀️✅, 2022. Happy to have made it to the mat this morning before getting my day started. Thanks Adrienne for your great attitude and for always being radiating, and transmitting positivity with us all.

I can't believe I almost skipped this practice! I woke up with a stiff neck and after quick scanning the video I almost substituted one of your upper back or neck videos thinking it would be more targeted for me, but in the end decided to stick with Adriene's plan. So glad I did!!! The message was so important for me to hear today. When you said we all need a day of rest I cried! So silly! But as a homeschooling mom of 4 kids ranging in age from kindergarten to highschool (currently working on lesson plans for the new year), moving cross country within the last year, doing major renovations to the new house, and trying to be present for my kids as we struggle with this modified quarantine craziness and lack of their usual activities, it hit me like a tone of bricks- I've been running on empty for some time now and not even realizing. I don't feel like I have time for any days off or "me time". Such a simple powerful message that I needed to hear today. Thank you!

So many thanks from the bottom of my heart, yoga did actually save my life :) xx

So weird thing. I cant seem to do the forward bend with my legs bent, they immediately splay out to the sides and I cant keep my knees together if theyre bent.  I just skip that and immediately straighten my legs all the way out, then I can bend forward enough to grab my ankles, toes, or feet.  Ive found that to be the case in a couple of poses, where I find the more challenging position "easier" than the modified ones.  I think as a plus size woman, I find a lot of things a little different because my belly gets in the way.  But I figure out how to make it work.  Yoga can be for everybody and for every-body 😁.   Practice #112 complete!

Adriene or anyone, I can't figure out what I'm doing wrong when you have us bring our ankles in as you did in this video.  My outer ankle and foot are just turned the wrong way and I can't get it to line up like you do in the video.  You always say that my knees may be way up in the air.  They aren't, and even if I bring them up, stuff still doesn't line up.  And when I try to lean forward, when my right ankle is in first, it hurts and feels wrong on the outside of my right knee.  Does anybody have any idea what I'm doing wrong, and what are the basics for a beginner to get started on this piece of things?  Thanks. I can’t believe it’s already day 22! I feel like I must’ve skipped some days, or time is going by really fast because I still feel like I just started this revolution with my FWFG community. I remember looking at all the asanas in the thumbnail photos thinking maybe I was being too ambitious, but that I was going to try anyways. I don’t regret giving this a chance at all, and I’ve loved every minute of watching my body transform is many pleasant and unexpected ways. 

Since my body has changed a bit, I spent this practice trying to figure out and play with my new center. I don’t have to pull in my knees and legs to the side anymore, so I’m getting used to pulling in through the middle. It’s weird, lol. I feel like this was gentle for my body by respecting that it changed and trying to understand the changes... am I right or am I reaching? Lol.

I had to do just one downward dog at the end. I love the feeling of the blood going the other way for some strange reason and now I’m satisfied. 😉 namaste family 🙏🏾
Beautiful, calming practice! 😍
aaaw you are awesome

Adriene, your dear practices, I have participated in them off and on since I was 15 years old. I am now 18 years old and they always help to keep me footed when life is stringing me along. I’m very sensitive to everything, admittedly. These last couple of years I have gone through a time in my life where all of my friends were depressed and had a burnout, pressing myself out of a burnout while moving countries and declining myself of any screen time for 2 months at the age of 16, rehabilitating myself from an eating disorder and introduced low carb diets into my life, had my life spun around, met someone to give me hope for my future and taken me to spend Christmas across the world in Texas, moved 2 times more, found a definite meaning to my life, found god and sang at my best friend’s beautiful wedding. 
I’ve crumbled and I’ve been told I’ve saved someone’s life. I have learnt to survive without always needing to be on the go, physically, some where. I have found God and I have conquered through family situations where I have had to flee our home with a caravan to not have my mother hit by my uncle. I have seen my wonderful nephews and nieces say they love me and felt love for the first time in my life since childhood and I have for the first time learnt to see lovingly in my body. And even though it is such a travel, and even though merely yesterday I suffered an anxiety attack on my friend’s graduation party so I had to leave.. Your grounding, soothing and miraculous spirit we get to take part of must be heaven sent. You are truly special and I have always seen myself in and been fond of you for how you shine and care for us here. I’ve found myself crying on my mat. Laying there without nothing but self loathe. Laying there with nothing but self love for the first time in the week. I have found myself caring for my body like I never had and I have found myself walking straighter through life than ever with it, and sagging down into a decreased sense of self worth without it. I have seen how you grow us. Grow us heartfelt and grow us into positive sprouts on the paths of our loved ones. Therefore I must lay a short text of praise for you on this channel. 
I can start writing a book of how you have helped me care for my body. 
This wonderful afternoon however, the sun is shining. & Even though it took me 1 hour as it usually does to start your video - I am never in doubt you change my life with your gentle and beautiful caring energy leading us on our own right paths destined for us in life by tuning into ourselves and finding peace when our world finds turmoil. ‘Everything is as it should be’ has stuck for me too. I am perfect as I am today even if realizing it myself takes courage. So today, when the sun is shining after I have been filled with a piece of this world’s needed love - I will lift my feet up & down and run as if my eating disorder never could have mattered to me yesterday or the day before. I can try again. I always want to try again. I am merely able to send my gratitude and bow. I hope you for the rest of your life can find peace in the lives you have changed. 
All the beautiful best for the rest of your journey in life & on the mat, Adriene. When your time here is passed is uncertain for me, but I hope you will stay lively and hearty for the rest of it. You have a lot to offer the world and you are letting us have a piece of your shine. I hope you find peace, love and hope wherever you go. Always, 
Alexandra Lumme
Yes, girl. Pausing and rewinding to get in some extra lovin'. Oh, how we so need to be gentle, and kinder to ourselves, and in turn, to others.let not the well run dry.
One think (from many) wich I love about you is how funny you are! Hahahha kisses from Brazil

I recently underwent surgery to have a lobe of my lung removed after the discovery of a rare tumour in my right lung. I had a thoracotomy (where they cut between your ribs to get to your lung) so they could remove the tumour and a section of my lung. I have been doing YWA videos daily for the last 2 years and this video is the first I have done in 2 weeks since my operation! I have literally never been so grateful for my breath and it brings a whole new meaning to the breathing aspect of yoga. I'm still working on getting my lung capacity back but I know that building my yoga practise back up gently will work wonders. I had a little trouble with the twists but i'll get back to normal soon! Thank you once again Adriene for sharing your gift with us and allowing yoga to be more accessible in our lives ~ Namaste 🙏🏼💖💚

I did this gorgeous yummy practice with my partner this morning! As a teacher I love hearing how each different person experiences asana, because everyone feels differently, and is going through and coming from different places. Being gentle to yourself is a phrase that usually makes my partner roll his eyes or chuckle when I say it, but lying in stillness, in supta badha konasana, while I’m massaging my (VERY TIGHT, ow omg!) hip creases, and trying to put myself in my partner’s shoes, or any cis man in today’s USA. I LOVE the tool of being silent, not responding to the idea of being gentle, just observing what it would be like to be gentle. Approach new and maybe unfamiliar things with curiosity rather than judgment. Silence and kindness are such powerful tools. So much food for thought, so much love in the room between my practice my partner and this beautiful sequence with your beautiful words. Thanks for sharing Adriene!

Thank you, from the bottom of my heart, for today’s exquisitely-timed practice. I have felt motivated and incredible every other day on this program, but today I was struggling with anxiety and on the verge of a panic attack. I was about to take my anti-anxiety med when I thought, “I’m going to do Day 22 and THEN see if I still need it after.” Needless to say, I was so grateful for this soft practice and I feel 100% better now. No meds needed, only the medicine of yoga! Thank you for keeping me healthy mentally and physically 💜

I did this practice with a blanket wrapped around me and it really helped with the self love and patience feel (not to mention cozy 😊). Would highly recommend! This practice was just what I needed today 😊

I love my mind for giving myself the ability to find freedom, I love that I am making time for doing this every day and my other daily activities, and I love that I challenge myself with all kinds of new things and continuing to learn about everything I can to grow as much as possible in this short life.
That was blissful, thank you so much! x x x

I came to the mat at the earlier time of 8:00am ready for day 22.  

I didn't expect it to be a "rest day" because every day has felt like a rest day as I also treat myself kindly and gentlely as a way moving through my wellness journey.  People, professionals in the wellness industry, have said to me, to treat myself kindly because of the journey I had been on.  Don't be too harsh on yourself and for me, I have bought that thought to the mat.  I push myself to my limits but if I need to hold back, I do, I find my breaking point and I ease off but still continue with the session.

Today, I felt like pushing myself to my full potential so while we were on our backs, stetching the thighs and harmstrings, I was happy to lay back and do some leg curls and crunches and work on my core.  It was a great little work out and something I needed to kick off my day.  I am becoming confident in my abilities on the mat and I am taking it upon myself to move at my own pace and to work at levels that suit me.  

At the beginning of the session, Adriene had us bend ourselves forward and because I have such trouble crossing my legs, I was happy to go for another pose but still going for the stretch.  I have to find the time in my day, to just learn to cross my legs and sit because I don't have the flexibility and I am sure I will get to the position once again.  I never sit on the floor and cross my legs because it reminds me of being back in primary school and now it just seems to be the right time to re-educate myself.  I must admit I feel as though I have good posture as I never slump in a chair and when I am at the computer my shoulder are never slumped forward and just from sitting at a chair has helped me through the sitting poses during this revolution.  All Adriene is doing to making sure we continue to have good posture even when we are sitting on a mat.  I also have to confess, I am one of those people who hate sitting on stool.  I find my posture is weak and so I never choose to sit on a stool whenever possible and so I am at times finding myself correcting my posture when I find I am going backwards..

With all the strengthening of the core and working on our innerself, I am feeling good everytime I come to the mat and leave the mat and today, I realised that you can rest but at the same time, you can find time to do some strengthening if you want to push yourself that little bit further.

I have been a massage therapist for over 4 years now and have worked at a physical therapy office for most of it. I got into a car accident about 2 years ago and had extreme pain in my low back afterwards, to the point where I couldn't even bend over. I've dealt with lower back pain ever since. After starting yoga with Adriene, I've noticed a significant difference with my lower back pain. Since starting I did a session of cupping and along with Adriene I can happily say I am now pain free! Thank you so much Adriene for your wonderful practices. They have helped me calm my anxiety, find strength both emotionally and physically, and heal my pain. Yoga is changing my life.
This was a wonderful, relaxing break. Loved this session of gentle yoga. Thank you, Adriene.

Today was a game-changer for me. I got to the mat today after a week of bad eating, no yoga, and overall being very inconsiderate to my body for many days. I was also mentally occupied with anxious thoughts about things that are not going too well and things I had no control over. 

I started the practice distracted, but midway something just shifted and my overall mood evolved into pleasant acceptance and mindfulness in such a big way that I couldn't help smiling until the end of the video??Does this happen to anyone else or am I bi-polar? Lol. 

Adriene, your thoughtful guidance and these yoga movements are moving mountains in people's lives, I hope you know. I now know I want yoga as a permanent part of my life. I'm getting off the mat positive and looking forward to my day. Namaste!

Last Summer  I started 30 days of Yoga With Adriene and I did not complete it. My daughter was 6 months old and I found it hard to do with all my mommy/wifey duties. I feel so much better, my neck and upper back would ache everyday. After the fourth or fifth day I noticed a difference and I no longer feel that tired achy sensation. THANK YOU for these videos. Taking time for myself with your yoga sessions makes me feel like I am showing myself a little love. I look forward to completing these 31 days and trying your Yoga Camp immediately. This so far has become part of my daily routine. You're awesome Adriene!!! This mommy needs this time for herself.

Adriene, dear Adriene. Its weird, cause somehow I feel like your a close friend. Lately I've really found the love and happiness that life actually contains - which unfortunately is just so very hidden by society's way of thinking: the right body, the right education, the right job - making 'the right' decision over and over again in your life. Luckily, I've found that 'whats right' will never become clear to me, without a deep connection with my inner-self. For so many years - almost my whole youth up until now - I've just had this feeling of, that I could never do 'it' right, the way that it was 'supposed' to. No matter how much effort I put into my fitness and healthy lifestyle, how well I did in school, how much right clothes and accesories I bought - I could just never find that feeling of satisfaction and peace. Your yoga videos has made it so much easier for me to find an inner peace, and keep on remembering being honest with myself, noticing how i feel, doing what just feels good - without no other reason. You make me feel good, you make me smile and laugh beacause of your random jokes and cutes little songbreakouts - so like everyone else, and I dont even know, if your actually reading this, but I just wanted to thank you as well. I've never been this happily consistent to anything before, without forcing me to do it, cause that 'was the right thing to do'. Thanks Adriene, I am really truly grateful for your effort and your sharing of love, peace and strenght - fysically and mentally!
Thank you for everything angel 😇❤💋 I live I love I am

So glad I came to the mat today, I'm really busy today but made time for this and I feel great for it. Thank you adriene!

Adriene! I don't know if you'll even see this, so many people must write to you everyday. Today I was angry. And I mean ANGRY. We have no money, we're strugling, my anxiety isn't helping this days, and some dumb guy cut down almost completely a plan/tree that my family and I have owned and loved for years. But somehow, in the middle of this practice (and while my dog started to lick my face with no cares for the yogas going on) I started to laugh. Really laugh! At how fleeting everything is, and how things will get better, we'll get the money we need, the tree will grow back, and my anxiety will hopefully CHILL SOMEDAY. So, thank you, my friend. For making my day better, and lifting my spirits, and for keep asking to stick with it as if you knew that I was thinking of quiting. Thank you thank you thank you. With love, from Argentina, Namaste <3

I'll be honest, yoga looked like such a boring practice until a few years ago. It was actually my favorite YouTube personal trainer Kelli (any Fitnessblender fam?) who highly recommended stretching and using yoga to improve flexibility, help with muscle soreness, etc. Nothing as meaningful as what Adriene invites us to explore in every video, but I would've never appreciated the gentleness and mindfulness of yoga if I had not started with the high impact routines, which I still swear by. For me yoga alone is not enough, but it definitely is the element that was missing to my fitness journey, especially from a mental and spiritual perspective.
Thank you for sharing this challenge with us Adriene!

I have been doing your January practices everyday and I was so upset when I woke up this morning in pain, I am 23 years old and I have severe Rheumatoid Arthritis so I have been so proud of myself for being able to follow along with these videos, obviously making adjustments where i need too. Today I woke up in so much pain in my wrists and arms and I was so sad thinking I would have to skip a day because this has been the best part of my day since I started! But then I read your mail and my eyes filled with tears when I saw no wrists, no downward dog, to give our arms a rest today! Thank you so much for giving me what I needed today and for showing me this practice can be gentle or fire, it can be exactly what we need and that it's Coming to the mat that's important. Thank you. A thousand times! Namaste.

Towards the end of today's practice, when Adriene talked about being kind to yourself (and others, of course), I began to cry because I know in my heart that I've never been able to be truly kind to myself--even on my good days there's still that nagging sense of guilt and damaging self-deprecation at the choices I've made in my life that have me far behind where I thought I'd be at this point in my life. But as someone who has struggled for years with mental health issues, I'm trying to forgive myself--and, yes, be kind to myself--as I know I can never move forward if I don't do both. It's never really easy, and I know it will be a lifelong challenge, but this journey has me feeling more positive about my present and future than I have in a long time. Thank you once again Adriene <3

Today was a very hard day to come to the mat. Anxiety got me today. But yet here I am 21:34 (9:34 pm) and made it through. I wish I would have done it eariler because I feel better now, calmer. So it was perfect that it was a softer one today and it's amazing what 22 min of yoga can do when you really give yourself permisson do breathe!
Finally got to the mat today & it was PERFECT! Just what this body needed. Thanks & Luv!
Day 21 and 22 back to back.  Two great practises, you rock Adrienne

Just got back from a 7day vacation in Cuba and couldnt bare the thought of going 7 days without yoga... So I downloaded the ''30 days of yoga'' from 2015. It was great!! My mom joined me every single day and now wants to get my dad to do it with her! Thank you for these amazing videos, they are a perfect way for me to cross-train and build strength into my very demanding running program, while keeping me healthy! My mom was so impressed with my flexibility... I used to be renowned in my family for not being able to touch my toes!! How times have changed!!

once this is over, I won't be able to stop!  I may do the 365 yoga I've seen some others talking about.... I might do ' most' of these over again lol! gaaah, I've said it before,  I'll say it again: THANK YOU ADRIEEENE!!!! how great to be doing the same exact thing at the same exact time as thousands of peeps around the world!

just want to send out peace and compassion to those in higher offices, as well. they are still human,  despite how they seem. to the protesters in America,  a salute to you! ! this WILL be a great year :)

Totally loving this experience.  My ankles and wrists and fingers and toes were so sore at first, but I have trusted this experience and the pain is now gone and I feel so much stronger.  My concern though is what do we do after these 31 days are over?  Are videos posted often?  I want this to continue!
Thank you Adriene for putting together this wonderful practice & making it available to the yoga community! From my heart to yours >Namaste<

Today didn't start well for me at all, and yesterday ended in a bad way too. My favourite and only mat got ripped and i never knew i'd be that sentimentally attached to it. I t is special however, because you signed it for me when i attended your class in London. Today all through the video i kept touching the ripped edge, i even cried a bit. The practise made me feel calmer though, and even though i hold very few things dear to me, things are things. If they broke we can fix them or replace them, but my personal journey of healing is irreplaceable and it will make me more aware to my position in life and the tools that could set me free.
